Class PatientTestCase

java.lang.Object
de.hshn.mi.pdbg.basicservice.AbstractServiceTestCase
de.hshn.mi.pdbg.basicservice.AbstractEntityTestCase
de.hshn.mi.pdbg.basicservice.PatientTestCase
public class PatientTestCase extends AbstractEntityTestCase
Checks all Patient-relevant methods of the implementation of BasicDBService and Patient

      @ParameterizedTest(name="createPatient with invalid lastname - #{index} - Arg={0}") @NullAndEmptySource @ValueSource(strings={" ","\t","\n"}) public void testCreatePatientInvalidLastname(String input)
      Attempts to create a Patient object using the method BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String) with invalid values for the parameter lastname (see: description in corresponding interface).
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String)

    • testCreatePatientCorrect

      @Test public void testCreatePatientCorrect()
      Attempts to create a Patient object using the method BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String). As the Patient object must not be directly stored after creating, this test checks if a Patient object exists in db, yet it should not.
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String)
      • PersistentObject.getObjectID()
      • Person.getLastname()
      • Person.getFirstname()
      • Person.getDateOfBirth()
      • Patient.getHealthInsurance()
      • Patient.getHospitalStays()
      • BasicDBService.getPatients(String, String, java.util.Date, java.util.Date)

    • testStorePatientInsertGetPatient

      @Test public void testStorePatientInsertGetPatient()
      Attempts to store and get a Patient object using the BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject) and BasicDBService.getPatient(long) methods. Test succeeds if
      1. storing the Patient object succeeds
      2. the number of all Patient objects in db increases by one
      3. getting the Patient object via its objectID succeeds
      4. the received Patient object matches the expected one
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String)
      • BasicDBService.getPatients(String, String, Date, Date)
      • BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject)
      • BasicDBService.getPatient(long)
      • Person.setDateOfBirth(Date)
      • Person.getDateOfBirth()
      • Person.setFirstname(String)
      • Person.getFirstname()
      • Patient.setHealthInsurance(String)
      • Patient.getHealthInsurance()
      • Patient.getHospitalStays()
      • Patient.setInsuranceNumber(String)
      • Patient.getInsuranceNumber()
      • Person.setLastname(String)
      • Person.getLastname()
      • PersistentObject.getObjectID()

    • testStorePatientUpdateGetPatient

      @Test public void testStorePatientUpdateGetPatient()
      Attempts to update and get a Patient object using the BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject) and BasicDBService.getPatient(long) methods. Test succeeds if
      1. storing the Patient object succeeds
      2. updating the Patient object succeeds
      3. the number of all Patient objects in db does not change
      4. getting the Patient object via its objectID succeeds
      5. the received Patient object matches the expected one
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String)
      • BasicDBService.getPatients(String, String, Date, Date)
      • BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject)
      • BasicDBService.getPatient(long)
      • Person.setDateOfBirth(Date)
      • Person.getDateOfBirth()
      • Person.setFirstname(String)
      • Person.getFirstname()
      • Patient.setHealthInsurance(String)
      • Patient.getHealthInsurance()
      • Patient.getHospitalStays()
      • Patient.setInsuranceNumber(String)
      • Patient.getInsuranceNumber()
      • Person.setLastname(String)
      • Person.getLastname()
      • PersistentObject.getObjectID()

    • testGetPatientNegativeInvalid

      @ParameterizedTest(name="getPatient with invalid OID values - #{index} - Arg={0}") @ValueSource(longs={-9223372036854775808L,-42L,0L,0L}) public void testGetPatientNegativeInvalid(long input)
      Attempts to get a Patient object using the method BasicDBService.getPatient(long) with invalid objectIDs (i.e. negative OIDs, PersistentObject.INVALID_OBJECT_ID, abd 0. [should result in no entry in db]).
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.getPatient(long)
      • BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String)

    • testGetPatientPositiveInvalid

      @ParameterizedTest(name="getPatient with invalid OID values - #{index} - Arg={0}") @ValueSource(longs=9223372036854775807L) public void testGetPatientPositiveInvalid(long input)
      Attempts to get a Patient object using the method BasicDBService.getPatient(long) with a positive, huge OID [should result in no entry in db].
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.getPatient(long)
      • BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String)

    • testGetPatients

      @Test public void testGetPatients()
      Attempts to ask the service for Patient objects using the BasicDBService.getPatients(String, String, Date, Date) method. Different variations of parameters (including wildcards) are used. See BasicDBService.getPatients(String, String, Date, Date) for further information.
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.getPatients(String, String, Date, Date)
      • BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String)
      • Person.setDateOfBirth(Date)
      • BasicDBService.store(PersistentObject)
      • Person.getDateOfBirth()
      • Person.getFirstname()
      • Patient.getHealthInsurance()
      • Patient.getInsuranceNumber()
      • Person.getLastname()

    • testGetSetHealthInsurance

      • Patient.setHealthInsurance(String)

    • testSetDateOfBirthInvalid

      @Test public void testSetDateOfBirthInvalid()
      Attempts to set the Patient's date of birth to an invalid value (i.e. a date after the current date). See Person.setDateOfBirth(Date) for description.
      Involved methods:
      • BasicDBService.createPatient(String, String)
      • Person.setDateOfBirth(Date)
